channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FABRIC-957] build 366 doesn't seem to work any more on windows
item.summary: build 366 doesn't seem to work any more on windows

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I wonder if this is related to FABRIC-958?

I can reproduce this on my windows box with -368

I'm also seeing this warning in log before I try to create fabric

I installed in C:Fuse\jboss-fuse-6.1.0.redhat-368\ so there is a "\" missing in name (full log attached)

17:34:50,833 | INFO | FelixStartLevel | AbstractComponent | 61 - io.fabric8.fabric-api - 1.0.0.redhat-368 | activateComponent: io.fabric8.zookeeper.curator.CuratorACLManager@4eda4a
17:34:51,203 | INFO | FelixStartLevel | AbstractComponent | 61 - io.fabric8.fabric-api - 1.0.0.redhat-368 | activateComponent: io.fabric8.service.ComponentConfigurer@1aba308
17:34:51,213 | WARN | FelixStartLevel | BootstrapConfiguration | 56 - io.fabric8.fabric-zookeeper - 1.0.0.redhat-368 | Failed to load users from etc/users.properties. No users will be imported.
java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:Fusejboss-fuse-6.1.0.redhat-368\etc\users.properties (The system cannot find the path specified)
at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)[:1.6.0_34]
at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:120)[:1.6.0_34]
at org.apache.felix.utils.properties.Properties.load(Properties.java:106)
at io.fabric8.zookeeper.bootstrap.BootstrapConfiguration.activate(BootstrapConfiguration.java:136)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)[:1.6.0_34]
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)[:1.6.0_34]
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)[:1.6.0_34]
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)[:1.6.0_34]
here's the full karaf log from a windows box with all the various exceptions that happen
Still see this on build -370, logs attached

Hi all,
I tried creating fabric witch 368 build on 3 windows machines:
my old notebook: windows 7Profesional SP1. Java 1.7.0_05; attached log: log.zip
my pesronal PC: windows 8.1 Profesional Java 1.7.0_45 log:logw8.1.zip
jenkins virtual Dev156: windows 2012 R2, Java 1.7.0_25 (probably). log:log2012.zip

I haven't configured all windows machines in any special way. Fabric seemed working (I could create child-containers at least) even if exceptions were thrown.

Logs are attached.

While testing the fix for FABRIC-959 on windows I hit this too. In my case I had an old fabric instance (from a few builds ago) running in the background. The new fabric was trying to connect to the old Git data store, which had different credentials and it just hung the creation process. Worked fine after I killed the old process. I'm wondering if that is what others are experiencing too?
That could be the case - I did get the failure at one stage but now the fabric create works OK for me despite the exception.

I'm pretty sure this has been resolved. Ioannis fixed the issue loading the users.properties file and fabric couldn't be created most likely because of an old process running on the same box.

Feel free to reopen if someone is hitting this even after a process cleanup.
Thanks for checking Keith. Let's reopen until we can recheck the next build with Ioannis' fix.

You can maybe use the normalizePath util we do in camel-core for windows vs unix paths
https://github.com/apache/camel/blob/master/camel-core/src/main/java/org/apache/camel/util/FileUtil.java#L67
Should be fixed, will resolve once we have validation from QE.
mmelko in QE has also confirmed that this is no longer an issue in -376

Error executing command: Unable to create zookeeper server configuration
